title: Farage calls on police to share immigration status of charged suspects
summary:
Farage calls on police to share immigration status of charged suspects4 days ago Share Save Alys Davies BBC News Share SaveEPA/ShutterstockNigel Farage has called on the police to release the immigration status of suspects charged with crimes following the arrest of two men in connection with the alleged rape of a 12-year-old girl in Warwickshire.
The Reform UK party leader said he "absolutely" thinks such details should be released when asked about the matter at a news conference on Monday.
Warwickshire Police said once someone is charged with an offence, the force follows national guidance that does not include sharing ethnicity or immigration status.
The authorised professional practice followed by forces across the country, and cited by the College of Policing, says the same.

title: Small boat migrants will be allowed to keep their phones, minister says
summary:
Migrants who arrive in Britain on small boats will be able to keep their mobile phones, a minister has said.
Dame Angela Eagle, a Home Office minister, said the Government “doesn’t want absolutely every phone” from those who cross the Channel.
Dame Angela Eagle doesn’t want a blanket policy of seizing all migrants’ phones - Dan Kitwood/GettyDame Angela said the Home Office would not be seeking the phones of every migrant who arrived on a small boat.

title: Stamps to be replaced with biometrics at EU border from 12 October
summary:
Biometrics to replace stamps at EU border from 12 OctoberIt was due to come into effect last November but has been beset by technological delays.
The Entry/Exit System (EES) will replace the current paper checks and will mean passengers from the UK will need to have their fingerprints and faces scanned to cross an EU border.
Stamps in people's passports will be replaced by biometric checks for people travelling in and out of the EU from 12 October, officials have confirmed.
Passengers will be given hand-held devices to register in their cars, while French border checks have been implemented on British soil at the Port of Dover, the Eurotunnel's Folkestone end and Eurostar's St Pancras terminal.
In May, the UK and EU struck a deal which allowed for UK nationals to use EU e-gates - but only after the EES is introduced.

title: Korean American researcher held at airport for weeks over decade-old weed conviction
summary:
Korean American researcher held at airport for weeks over decade-old weed convictionA 40-year-old scientist and legal permanent resident has been detained by the U.S. Customs and Border Protection at San Francisco International Airport since July 21.
According to his legal team , he has previously traveled internationally for academic work without incident.
Since his detention began, he has had almost no communication with family or counsel, and his legal team believes he may now be held at a facility in Arizona.

title: Get Batman: Arkham City, Shadow of Mordor, and 14 more games for $12
summary:
